question: The English East India Company was formed by a group of merchants known as
explanation: In 1599 AD, the English East India Company was formed by a group of merchants known as ‘The Merchant Adventurers’. The charter to the new company was granted by Queen Elizabeth and gave it the monopoly of eastern trade for 15 years. Later, before the expiry of 1st charter, James II (King of England ) gave monopoly for indefinate period.
